sources.text:
# B737-800 HYDRAULIC POWER SYSTEM (SIMULATION DATA)

## 1.0 General System Description
The aircraft uses three independent hydraulic systems: System A, System B, and the Standby System.The nominal operating pressure for all main systems is 3000 psig.### 1.1 System A Components
System A is powered by:
1.**Engine-Driven Pump (EDP):** Located on the No.1 Engine accessory drive.2.**Electric Motor-Driven Pump (EMDP):** Powered by the AC Transfer Bus 2.In the simulator, the fluid dynamics are calculated by the `hyd_model_a.cpp` module.The reservoir quantity is represented by the variable `sim_hyd_sys_a_qty`.If this variable drops below 20%, the `LOW QTY` light on the overhead panel will illuminate.### 1.2 System B Components
System B is powered by one EDP on the No.2 Engine and one EMDP powered by AC Transfer Bus 1.Note that the cooling lines for System B run through the fuel tank, meaning hydraulic overheating can occur if fuel quantity is low.## 2.0 SIMULATOR FAULT LOGIC (IOS)

The Instructor Operating Station (IOS) uses specific malfunction codes to trigger failures.The model uses a decay rate logic to simulate leaks.| Malfunction ID | Description | Simulation Effect | Trigger Variable |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **MALF_HYD_001** | Sys A EDP Failure | Pressure drops to 0 PSI in 3.5 seconds.| `ios_malf_hyd_edp_a_fail` |
| **MALF_HYD_005** | Sys B Slow Leak | Quantity drops 2% per minute.| `ios_malf_hyd_leak_rate` |
| **MALF_ELEC_PUMP** | EMDP Overheat | Pump case temp exceeds 115°C, tripping thermal breaker.| `ios_malf_emdp_ovht` |

> **NOTE:** If `MALF_HYD_005` is active, the Standby System will NOT automatically activate unless the force flight control switch is toggled.## 3.0 QTG VALIDATION TOLERANCES (FAA PART 60)

For the simulator to be certified (Level D), the hydraulic control loading (feel system) must meet the following objective test criteria:

### 3.1 Control Loading Static Friction
* **Elevator:** Breakout force must be within ± 2.0 lbs of aircraft data.

raulic control loading (feel system) must meet the following objective test criteria:

### 3.1 Control Loading Static Friction
* **Elevator:** Breakout force must be within ± 2.0 lbs of aircraft data.* **Aileron:** Breakout force must be within ± 1.5 lbs of aircraft data.* **Rudder:** Breakout force must be within ± 5.0 lbs of aircraft data.### 3.2 Dynamic Response
When a step input is applied to the hydraulic actuator model (`actuator_step_input`), the system response time (Time to 90% steady state) must match the aircraft validation data within **150 milliseconds**.## 4.0 TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

**Symptom:** Hydraulic System A pressure fluctuates during motion visuals.**Possible Cause:**
1.Check the `HOST` to `IG` (Image Generator) latency.High network traffic can cause UDP packet loss.2.Verify the `A01_HYD_PUMP` curve in the `data_tables.cfg` file.3.Ensure the "Sound Server" is not desynchronized, as sound cues (pump whine) are driven by the `hyd_pressure_a` variable.
